ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class aims to bring together the cohort of senior thesis theatermakers for that semester. It's quite successful in its structure, with design presentations by each group and critical responses, along with the few other classes that we spend on reflecting on our identities as artists, and how we'd like to move through the world. I came away with a fantastic senior thesis, an artist manifesto, and a portfolio (artist's website) that I'm really proud of!
A LOT! Most of the learning comes from developing your own Senior Project; HOWEVER, it is super helpful to work together and give feedback to your fellow classmates!
I learned how to write multiple drafts of a play in a semester, which is insane.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: we get really intimate as a class as we spend so much time discussing our projects in depth with each other! Our design presentations created conversation that ultimately impacted the direction of our thesis in surprising and formative and wonderful ways; critical reflections helped me articulate things about my own production that would make their way into my thesis essay.
This class is meant to support those undergoing curricular productions but often felt periphery rather than directly supportive/useful.
I wish they had more stuff for those who werent doing productions. I felt disconnected from the course because I didnt have to be there.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're a TAPS major you have to take this class if you're doing a production for your thesis!
Yes, if you are majoring in Theater & Performance Studies. It's mandatory.
